name: Pilot
description: Rare.

name: Apolon
description: A Slovenian hybrid that is a cross between Brewer's Gold and a Yugoslavian wild male.  Once thought to be related to Super Styrian.  Traditionally bred for bittering can also be used as an aroma hop.

name: Aquila
description:
Substitutes: Cluster
No longer commercially grown.

name: Greensburg
description: American hop variety from southern Idaho.  Fruity flavor with a touch of wood flavor.  Popular with microbreweries.

name: Pilgrim
description: Substitutes: N/A

name: African Queen 2018
description:
Because of the excellent alpha acids content and good yields, J17/63 gives a very high alpha acid production per hectare.

Cohumulone 26.5%, Storeability (Pellets) TBC, Isomerisation (Pellets) TBC, Total Oil ml/100g 1.3%, Humulene 21.4%, Caryophyllene 12.8%, Hum/Car Ratio 1.7, Farnesene 4.9, Myrcene 28.4%

name: African Queen 2017
description:
Because of the excellent alpha acids content and good yields, J17/63 gives a very high alpha acid production per hectare.

Cohumulone 26.5%, Storeability (Pellets) TBC, Isomerisation (Pellets) TBC, Total Oil ml/100g 1.3%, Humulene 21.4%, Caryophyllene 12.8%, Hum/Car Ratio 1.7, Farnesene 4.9, Myrcene 28.4%

name: Challenger
description:
Aroma: Fruity in flavor, spicy aroma, blends well
Substitutes: N/A

name: Jarrylo
description:
Notes: Underwhelming hop. Good if used in combination of hops with stronger flavors like Amarillo.

Aroma: Banana, pear, spice.

name: Bouclier
description: A cross between Alsace grown Strisselspalt and a wild male plant from Wye, Kent.  Grassy with hints of spice.  Aromas of herbs, grass, spice with some floral and citrus character.

name: Summit
description: Substitutes: Warrior, Millenium, Columbus, Tomahawk, Zeus

name: Cryo - Cascade
description: A classic Pacific NW Hops - floral, citrusy, prized in IPAs.  Lupulin powder - typically used during the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half the weight of pellet hops to mazimize aroma/flavor.  Concentrated to enhance hop oils. Store near freezing.

name: Centennial Hop Hash
description:
Technically this is lupulin powder similar to Cryo-hops.  It is intended for use primarily in the whirlpool, hot steep or for dry hopping.

Columbus, Tomahawk and Zeus are collectively called CTZ and are similar in character and often blended.  They provide citrus aromas, black peper, licorace and curry notes.

name: Aurora
description: Substitutes: Styrian Goldings

name: HBC 342 (Experimental)
description:
Storage: Unknown
??% AA / ??% Beta

name: Azacca
description:
Notes: Dual purpose hop. Good for dry hopping
Aroma: Citrus, tropical, floral

name: Pacific Hallertau (aka Pacifica)
description:
Storage: Good/Very Good
5-6% AA / 5.5-6.2% Beta

name: Green Bullet
description:
Aroma: Floral, raisin aroma.
Substitutes: Styrian Goldings

name: Tettnang (Tettnang Tettnager)
description:
Storage: Poor
2.5-6% AA / 3-5% Beta

name: Glacier
description:
Aroma: Excellent, hoppy
Substitutes: N/A

name: Herald
description:
Aroma: Strong, acceptable
Substitutes: High alpha English bittering hops

name: Marynka
description: Substitutes: Chinook, English Golding

name: Olympic
description: Substitutes: Brewers Gold

name: Sun
description:
Aroma: Pleasant, hoppy
Substitutes: Other very high alpha US hops

name: Hallertauer Mittelfrueh
description:
Substitutes: Hallertauer, Mt. Hood, Liberty, Crystal
Examples: Sam Adams Boston Lager, Sam Adams Boston Lightship

name: Kirin II
description: A Japenese hop that grew from Japan's decision to reduce hop imports.  Grown domestically in Japan under government contract.  Developed by Kirin Brewery, it is a direct descendant of Saaz and White Vine.

name: Comet
description: Substitutes: N/A

name: Junga
description: A high alpha bittering hop from Poland similar in some ways to German Magnum but with a nuce aroma.  Derived from a Saaz variety.  Substitute: Nugget, German Magnum or Target

name: N1/69 2018
description:
zahops.com: "The aroma profile of N1/69 is Kool-Aid, Juicy Fruit, mango, citrus, plums, dank, and pungent.  Alpha acids are 13.4 percent and cohumulone is 23 percent in 2016."
northernbrewer.com: "pineapple, citrus, and melon flavors, along with some Juicy Fruit and Kool-Aid notes. Try it in your next IPA or APA. Typical Alpha Acids 13%. Aroma hop. Perfect for tropical IPAs. Typical Alpha Acids 13%. "

name: Tahoma
description: Citrus and lemon notes with cedar, pine, floral, pepper and subtle green melon notes. Daughter of Glacier that retains the very low cohumulone characteristic of Glacier with somewhat higher alpha acid content.

name: Golding, U.S.
description:
Used for: Bitter
Substitutions: Fuggle, Willamette, UK East Kent Golding, Styrian Golding

name: El Dorado Hop Hash
description:
Technically this is lupulin powder similar to Cryo-hops.  It is intended for use primarily in the whirlpool, hot steep or for dry hopping.

El Dorado brings forward some tropical fruit flavors of pear, watermelon and stone fruit.

name: Eroica
description:
Substitutes: Galena, Northern Brewer, Chinook
Examples: Blackhook Porter, Ballard Bitter

name: Teamaker
description: Developed by the USDA, Teamaker was released in the late 2000's.  It is a unique high beta, very low alpha breed sued in medicine and food industries as well as brewing.  It has very strong antibiotic properrties, and makes a tasty iced tea.  It imparts almost no bittering content, but has floral aromas.  Use as a late addition either whirlpool or dry hopping.

name: Zlatan
description: A Czech hop released in 1976 and derived from Saaz.  Created in Zatac by the Hop Research Institute it attempts to maintain the character and aroma of Saaz.  It has a more mild bitterness and noble aroma if used late, as a whirlpool or dry hop addition.

name: Agnus
description:
Storage: Unknown
9-15% AA / 4-8% Beta

name: Tomahawk
description: Substitutes: Tomahawk, Zeus, Nugget, Galena, Chinook

name: Mandarina Bavaria
description:
Storage: Unknown
7-10% AA / 4-7% Beta

name: Northern Brewer
description: Examples: Anchor Steam, Old Peculiar,

name: Mosaic (HBC 369)
description:
Storage: Good (25% AA after 6 months at 20 C)
11-13.5% AA / 3.2-3.9% Beta

name: Pekko
description:
Notes: Any style that coud incorporate Saaz could use Pekko.

Aroma: Floral, mint, herbal, citrus

name: Cryo - Simcoe
description: An earthly, citrus, pine hop widely used in IPAs and many American styles.  Lupulin powder - typically used during the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half the weight of pellet hops to mazimize aroma/flavor.  Concentrated to enhance hop oils. Store near freezing.

name: Flyer
description: A cross between a high alpha female breeding line and low trellis male. Released for trials in 2009.  A citrus hop with aromas of stoned fruit, liquorice, tracle-toffee and caramel with slight burnt notes.  Spicy, resinous, citrus and liquorice notes.

name: Hallertau Blanc
description:
Substitutions: N/A
Storage Unknown

name: Nugget
description:
Substitutes: Chinook
Examples: Sierra Nevada Porter

name: Viking
description: Developed in 1968 at Wye College in England.  A cross between Svalof and an English male plant.  High alpha for a British hop - the aroma is described as pleasant and hoppy.

name: Southern Dawn
description: A relatively new South African hop used by some large breweries.  Resembles Southern Promise but with a different aroma profile.  Has a fruity, spicy aroma and is relatively neutral when bittering.

name: Amallia
description: A native plant from New Mexico and part of the neomexicana varietal.  Trialed by Michigan State University in 2014. A deeply earthy aroma with flavors of orange citrus. Well suited for brown or dark ales.

name: Chinook
description: Examples: Sierra Nevada Stout, Sierra Nevada Celebration Ale

name: Columbus (Tomahawk)
description:
Aroma: Pungent, spicy. Strongly aromatic, but clean tasting bitterness
Substitutes: Centennial

name: Fuggle, Organic
description:
As Fuggle (U.K.), only organic variety
Typical alpha: 3-5%. Organically grown Fuggle hops from the UK. Wonderful earthy, pipe-tobacco, floral character. Classic hop for any English ale.

name: Hallertauer, New Zealand
description: Substitutes: Hallertauer Mittelfrueh

name: Herkules
description:
Storage: Good
13-17% AA / 4-5.5% Beta

name: Galena
description:
Substitutes: Eroica, Northern Brewer, Cluster, Chinook
Examples: Catamount Porter

name: Lublin
description:
Aroma: Noble, mild flavor similar to Saaz
Substitutes: Saaz, Tettnanger

name: SAB PIH Blend
description: Blend Pre-isomerised hops. 12-14% (70% S.Star, 25% S.Prom. 5% other).

name: Satus
description:
High alpha bittering hops from Yakima that is similar to Galena.  Of recent origin.  
Substitutes: Galena

name: Ella
description: Ella was formerly known as Stella.  Its an Australian variety that is a half sister to Galaxy and related to Spalt.  It was released in 2007 for trials and became quite popular.  Ella has a very high aromatic oil content that changes depending on how its used.  In small quantities it provides a spicy, floral quality like star anise.  Larger quantities or dry hopping provide more of a tropical or grapefruit flavor.

name: Cryo - Palisade
description: A earthy, floral, fruity hop used for aroma including apricot, grass and floral components. Lupulin powder - typically used during the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half the weight of pellet hops to mazimize aroma/flavor.  Concentrated to enhance hop oils. Store near freezing.

name: Super Alpha
description:
Aroma: Pleasant, resin like aroma
Substitutes: N/A

name: Goldings, B.C.
description: Substitutes: East Kent Goldings, Fuggles

name: Progress
description: Substitutes: Fuggles

name: Southern Passion 2014
description: Cohumulone 16.6-20.2%, Total Oil ml/100g 0.8-1.0%, Humulene 17-26%, Caryophyllene 10-13%, Hum/Car Ratio 2.7 - 3.4%, Farnesene 0.1-0.4%, Myrcene 20-35%

name: Southern Star
description: Southern Star

name: Southern Passion 2018
description: Cohumulone 16.6-20.2%, Total Oil ml/100g 0.8-1.0%, Humulene 17-26%, Caryophyllene 10-13%, Hum/Car Ratio 2.7 - 3.4%, Farnesene 0.1-0.4%, Myrcene 20-35%

name: 92P24 2015
description: "Bittering hop with and alpha of ±14.5%"

name: Serebrianka (Silver Hops)
description: A Russian aroma hop that is actually a parent of Cascade. Not widely grown in the US, but still available in some areas.  Hints of black tea, herbs, tobacco with high humulene and fanesene content that contributes to pleasant continental aroma and taste.

name: Southern Passion 2017
description: Cohumulone 16.6-20.2%, Total Oil ml/100g 0.8-1.0%, Humulene 17-26%, Caryophyllene 10-13%, Hum/Car Ratio 2.7 - 3.4%, Farnesene 0.1-0.4%, Myrcene 20-35%

name: Southern Passion 2016
description: Cohumulone 16.6-20.2%, Total Oil ml/100g 0.8-1.0%, Humulene 17-26%, Caryophyllene 10-13%, Hum/Car Ratio 2.7 - 3.4%, Farnesene 0.1-0.4%, Myrcene 20-35%

name: Belma
description:
Storage: Unknown
9.8% AA / ??% Beta (5 year avg not yet established)

name: Bitter Gold
description: Substitutions: Galena, Nugget

name: Ahtanum
description:
Aroma: Distinctive floral and citrus aromas
Substitutes: Amarillo, Cascade

name: Cascade, New Zealand
description: Substitutions: Centennial, Amarillo

name: SAB T90 Blend 2011
description: Unknown blend??

name: SAB T90 Blend 2010
description: Unknown blend??

name: Feux-Coeur
description: Australian hop with genetic roots back to Burgundy France.  Fairly rare breed from Victoria.

name: Defender
description: Bred from a New Mexico wild female and Eastwell Golding male at Wye College, England.  Low alpha and yield has limited acreage.  A pleasant European style aroma.

name: Delta
description:
Storage: Excellent (80-90% AA after 6 months at 20 C)
5-7% AA / 5-7% Beta

name: Pioneer
description:
Aroma: Mild English hop aroma
Substitutes: East Kent Goldings

name: El Dorado Hop Extract
description:
CO2 Hop Extract -sold in both 0.5kg (150 gma), 1 kg (300 gma), 2 kg, 3kg and 4kg cans.  Extracted from El Dorado hops and only for use in the boil.  Measure out liquid in ml for use.

Check alpha percentage listed here against the can as alpha may vary by season and manufacturer.

name: Goldings, US
description: UK Golding clones have been introduced for growing here in Washington and Oregon. Before being grown in the US, there was a Golding grown in British Columbia (BC Golding), there are no longer any more BC Golding hops grown.

name: Liberty, New Zealand
description: Mild and spicy, subtle lemon and citrus. Used in many styles. Contributes good bitterness in the beginning of the boil and an aroma of grapes, peaches, and vanilla at the end of the boil. Derived from Hallertau Mittlefruh.

name: Palisade
description:
Also called YCR-4, Palisade is an aroma variety bread by Yakima Chief Ranches.  It has both aromatic and moderate bittering properties.  
Substitutes: Willamette

name: Golding, New Zealand
description: Substitutions: NZ Willamette, NZ Styrian Golding, NZ Fuggle, UK East Kent Golding

name: Denali (Exp 06277)
description: Formerly hopsteiner experimental #06227.  Denali is a high alpha aroma hop with heritage to Zeus and Nugget as well as a USDA male.  It has a big aroma including pineapple, citrus and pine notes.  High essential oil content makes it suitable for dry hopping or whirlpool additions such as IPAs.

name: Fuggle, New Zealand
description: Substitutions: UK Fuggle, NZ Willamette, NZ Styrian Golding

name: Legacy
description: Legacy has been cultivated in Washington state for over 50 years, but was registered and named in 2013.  It has some wild notes of blackberry, black currant, orange, grapefruit and florap and spicy notes.

name: Moutere
description: Substitutions: N/A

name: Amethyst
description: Low alpha aroma hops related to saaz grown in the Czech Republic. Citrusy, earthly and spicy.  Substitutes: Saaz

name: Chinook Hop Extract
description:
CO2 Hop Extract -sold in both 0.5kg (150 gma), 1 kg (300 gma), 2 kg, 3kg and 4kg cans.  Extracted from Centennial hops and only for use in the boil.  Measure out liquid in ml for use.

Check alpha percentage listed here against the can as alpha may vary by season and manufacturer.

name: Tardif de Bourgogne
description: "Late Burgundy" hops grown in small quantities in Alsace, France.  A mild European style aroma. Very limited quantities commercially.

name: Calicross
description: New Zealand Calicross was developed in the 1960's and largely disappeared in the 1980s.  Can still occasionally be found.  A cross between Fuggle and Late Cluster.  Earthy, fruity flavors with floral aromas.  Substitute: Cluster

name: Nelson Sauvin
description: Substitutes: None

name: Motueka
description: Substitutes: Saaz

name: HBC 438
description: An experimental hop that is a cross between a neomexicanus and YCR 123.  It is sister to HBC 472 and has similar character.  Aromas include mango, coconut, grapefruit, lemon grass and wood.  Peachy stone fruit, pineapple., lime and herbal notes of cedar and coconut.  A disctinct hop.  Subsitute: HBC 472

name: Select Spalt
description:
Aroma: Very fine, spalt aroma
Substitutes: Spalter, Saaz, Tettnang

name: Melba
description: Called the "Dame of Hops", Melba is a dual purpose hop from Australia's Ellerslie Hop Estate.  It has a high oil content and moderate alpha acid making it suitable for late and dry hop additions.  Adds a spicy bitterness. Aromatics of passion fruit, grapefruit, and citrus.  Comparable to Galaxy.

name: Gold
description: Daughter of Styrian Savinsjki Golding released in 2009.  Distinct aroma grown only in Slovenia.  Aroma of honey, oregano, basil, nettle and hay.

name: Jester
description: Developed by Charles Faram and Co, a proprietary hop different than most UK hops.  Aromatic notes of tropical fruit, grapefruit, blackcurrent and Lychee.  A late addition or dry hop, but not recommended for bittering in the boil.  Closer to a New World hop style.

name: Orbit
description: Selected from a NZ hop breeding program, available in limited quantities.  Resinous, piney, aromatic and some notes of tropical fruit.  Some variation from year to year due to varieties selected.

name: Aurora (Super Styrian Aurora)
description:
Storage: Excellent/Very Good (80-85% AA after 6 months at 20 C)
7-9% AA/ 3-5% Beta

name: Fuggle, U.S.
description: Substitutions: Willamette, UK Fuggle, Styrian Golding

name: Columbia
description:
Aroma: Close to Fuggles
Substitutes: Fuggles, Williamette

name: Pacific Sunrise
description: A bittering hop released by Hort Research in 2000.  limited production.  A pleasant piney aroma.  Cross between a California Late Cluster, Fuggle and New Zealand male plant.

name: Super Galena
description: Substitutes: Galena

name: Canadian Redvine
description: From Canada and very disease resistant.  It has a very high cohumulone content and low alpha making it a good late hop candidate.  Aroma and flavor of berries, pine, cherry and grapefruit peel.

name: Citra
description: Substitutes: Unknown

name: Cryo - Citra
description: Lupulin powder - typically used during the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half the weight of pellet hops to mazimize aroma/flavor.  Concentrated to enhance hop oils. Store near freezing.

name: Wakatu (Hallertau Aroma)
description:
Storage: Good
6.5-8.5% AA / 8-9% Beta

name: Hallertauer
description: Substitutes: Crystal, Liberty, Hallertauer Mittelfrueh

name: Crystal
description: Substitutes: Hallertauer, Mount Liberty

name: HopShot
description:
CO2-extracted hop resin that can be used for bittering or late additions to boiling wort.  Primarily for use in boil.  Made from Columbus (or CTZ) blend hops.
http://www.northernbrewer.com/documentation/hopshot.pdf

name: Feux Coeur Francais
description: Rare, high alpha hops from Australia with genetic roots in the Burgundy region of France.  It was adopted to the Victoria region of Australia and introduced in 2010.

name: Huell Melon
description: Storage Unkonwn

name: Sybilla
description: A varity from Poland which is primarily for bittering but has some good aromatic properties.  A mix of Lublin and Slovenian Styrian Goldings.  Good aroma hop with soft contintental character similar to a German Hallertauer, English Fuggles or Sterling.

name: Archer
description: A new variety from the Charles Faram Hop program.  Classic British aroma with a citrus twist.  Aroma is floral with delicate hints of lime and peach.  Provides traditional British assertiveness.

name: Relax
description: From Barth-Haas group - originally bred for tea and not beer.  Only 0.25% alpha acid and a huge beta acid punch and high oil content.  Use in whirlpool or dry hop for aroma oils.  Aromas of alpine meadows, lemongrass, hibiscus, cornflower and honeydew melons.

name: Sterling
description:
Aroma: Herbal, spicy, some floral and citrus hints
Substitutes: Saaz, Polish Lublin

name: Tradition
description:
Aroma: Fine - similar to Hallertauer Mittelfrueh
Substitutes: Hallertauer Mittelfrueh, Liberty, Ultra

name: Brooklyn
description: Substitutions: N/A

name: Cashmere
description: Substitutions: N/A

name: Falconer's Flight 7C's Blend
description:
Storage: Unknown
9-10% AA / 4.5% Beta

name: Liberty
description:
Substitutes: Hallertau, Mt Hood, Crystal
Examples: Pete's Wicked Lager

name: Cekin
description: Developed at the Hop Research Inst in Slovnia in the 1980's.  A cross between Aurora and a Yugoslav male.  Not grown in large quantities.  Pleasing and continental aroma similar to Savinjski Golding.  Substitute: Savinjski Golding or Aurora

name: Amarillo
description:
Storage: Good
8-11% AA / 6-7% Beta

name: U3/108 2018
description: Experimental SAB hop

name: Bullion
description: Substitutes: Chinook, Eroica, Brewer's Gold

name: Styrian Golding (Savinja Golding)
description:
Storage: Very Good
4.5-6% AA / 2-3.5% Beta

name: Southern Promise 2009
description: Yugoslavian male.

name: Gesho Kitel
description: Brundo's aroma hops Gesho stems, gathered from the highlands of Ethiopia, are sun-dried and packed fresh. These aromatic sticks and stem flavor centuries old traditional brewing recipes for beer and Ethiopian honey wine. Acid content unknown.

name: Phoenix
description:
Aroma: Similar to Wye Challenger hops
Substitutes: Challenger, East Kent Golding, Northdown

name: Northdown
description:
Aroma: Good bittering, flavor and aroma
Substitutes: Northern Brewer

name: Spalter Select
description:
Storage: Good/Fair
3-6.5% AA / 2.5-5% Beta

name: Sussex
description:
Sustitution: N/A
Storage: Unknown

name: Cascade
description: Examples: Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, Anchor Liberty Ale

name: Beata Hops
description: Beata is a low alpha British aromatic hop developed at Wye College in the UK in 1995 though it did not go into production until 2006.  Lovely aroma, with classic British complexity.  High beta levels also contribute unique properties.  Honey, apricot and almond notes.

name: Mathon White
description:
A very old varitety which may have been bred from Farnham Whitebine or Caturbury Whitebine like Goldings was.  A pleasant aroma similar to Goldings.  Goes well in most any English style.
Substitute: Kent Goldings or Bramling

name: Columbus/Tomahawk/Zeus (CTZ)
description:
Storage: Poor/Very Poor (45-65% AA after 6 months at 20 C)
14-16.5% AA / 4-5% Beta

name: Whitbread Golding Variety (WGV)
description:
Aroma: Pleasant, hoppy, slightly intense
Substitutes: East Kent Goldings, Progress

name: Cluster
description: Substitutes: Eroica, Galena

name: Monroe
description: A new hop variety from Barth-Haas group.  Only 2.5% apha but a fairly high oil content.  Mild and smooth, full of red aromas including raspberry notes and orange syrup.

name: Willamette, New Zealand
description: Substitutions: US Willamette, Fuggles

name: Hallertauer Hersbrucker
description:
Substitutes: Mt. Hood, Liberty, Hallertauer, Mittelfrueh
Examples: Wheathook Wheaten Ale

name: Southern Promise 2010
description: Yugoslavian male.

name: Centennial
description:
Substitutes: Galena, Eroica, Nugget, Bullion
Examples: Sierra Nevada Celebration Ale, Sierra Nevada Bigfoot

name: Pacific Jade
description: Substitutes: N/A

name: Southern Brewer
description: Developed in the early 1970's to grow in South Africa after Golden Cluster was devistated by black root.  Primarily a bittering hop, not known for its aroma or unusual flavors.  Did not grow as well in limited sunlight but was bread to create Southern Promise.

name: HBC 366 (Experimental)
description:
Storage: Unknown
14.4-15.6% AA / 4.6-5.1% Beta

name: Southern Promise
description: A high alpha hop bred in South Africa.  Created from Southern Brewer and a wild Slovenian male hop, it was bred to grow in limited sunlight.  Has a high alpha acid and cohumulone content giving it bright, smooth bittering qualities.  Can be dual-use with woody and earthy qualities.

name: Spalter
description:
Substitutes: Saaz, Tettnang
Examples: Dusseldorf Altbiers

name: Sonnet Golding
description:
Substitutions: Saaz,East Kent Golding and Crystal.
Storage: Unknown

name: Kohatu
description: Substitutions: N/A

name: Yakima Gold
description: A Washington State developed hop released in 2013.  It has mild bittering and aroma properties and is a good dual-use hop.  It decends from Early Cluster and a wild Slovenian male, so it has some Saaz like properties.  Aromas include smooth hop flavor with a hint of lemon zest and grapefruit.  Substitute: Saaz, Cluster, Cascade

name: Sticklebract
description:
Aroma: Pine-like with a hint of citrus
Substitutes: Northern Brewer

name: Pride of Ringwood
description: Substitutes: Cluster, Galena

name: Topaz
description: Very high alpha hop variety from Australia.  Used for commercial production primarily for its high alpha acid content and high bitterness.

name: Simcoe
description:
Aroma: Citrus and pine-like aroma
Substitutes: N/A

name: Saaz
description:
Substitutes: Tettnanger, Lublin
Examples: Pulsner Urquell

name: Vital
description: A high alpha hop from the Zatac breeding program.  High alpha and beta content provide a spicy aroma.  Used in some single hop pale ales with success.

name: Harmonie
description:
With typical Czech aroma, Harmonie's finely balanced bitterness "persists" slightly longer than Saaz. Bohemie, released in 2010, is a similar Czech hop with traditional aroma.
5-8% AA / 5-8% Beta

name: Brewer's Gold, Germany
description:
Substitutions: Galena, Northdown, Northern Brewer
Storage: Unknown

name: Zeus
description:
Aroma: Aromatic, pleasant
Substitutes: Other high alpha hops

name: Mt. Hood
description: Substitutes: Hallertauer, Liberty, Crystal

name: Gargoyle
description: Gargoyle along with Ivanhoe are the first generation of California Cluster hops to be grown commercially in over 50 years.  Revived by Hops-Mesiter near Clearlake CA.  Similar to Ivanhoe but has a more citrus-mango bouquet.  Substitute: Ivanhoe

name: Mt. Rainier
description:
Storage: Unknown
5-8.1% AA / 5-7% Beta

name: El Dorado
description:
Storage: Good
14-16% AA / 7-8% Beta

name: Smaragd (Emerald)
description:

4-6% AA / 3.5-5.5% Beta

name: Styrian Celeja
description:
Storage: Unknown 
3-6% AA / ??% Beta

name: Sylva
description:
Storage: Unknown
4-7.3% AA / 3-5% Beta

name: Triskel
description: Triskel was developed in France in 2006.  It is a cross from Strisselspalt and Yoeman from England.  It is often used in Belgian ales and featured as a late, whirlpool or dry hop.  It has floral and citrus notes with a fruity finish.  Comes from Alsace.

name: HBC 291 (Experimental)
description:
Storage: Unknown
11.2-13.1% AA / 5.1-6.1% Beta

name: Styrian Bobek
description:
Storage: Good
3.5-7% AA / 4-6.1% Beta

name: Cryo - Mosaic
description: Mosaic is an earthy, floral, fruity hops widely used for finishing IPAs.  Lupulin powder - typically used during the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half the weight of pellet hops to mazimize aroma/flavor.  Concentrated to enhance hop oils. Store near freezing.

name: Perle, U.S.
description: Substitutions: Northern Brewer, German Northern Brewer, German Perle

name: Willamette
description:
Substitutes: Fuggles, East Kent Goldings
Examples: Sierra Nevada Porter, Ballard Bitter

name: Chelan
description: Substitutes: Galena

name: Victoria
description:
Hi alpha hops grown in Victoria, Australia.  It was created in 1976 and entered commercial production in the 1990s.
Used for: Primarily for bittering due to high alpha content.

name: Atlas (Styrian Atlas)
description:
Storage: Very Good
7-11% AA / 3.2-41% Beta

name: Endeavour
description: Bred at Wye Hops in the UK as a cross between Cascade and a hedgerow hop.  A wonderful, citrusy hedgerow hop with complex blackcurrant, loganberry and spicy notes as well as grapefruit and lime flavor.  Gentler than cascade.  Substitutes: Cascade

name: Chinook, New Zealand
description: Substitutions: Southern Cross, Sticklebract, Nugget, Northern Brewer

name: Eukanot
description: Released in 2014 - has strong aroma character and a very high aromatic oil content. Aroma profile includes citrus, tropical fruit, fruity and herbal components.  Flavors include melon, berry, orange peel, lime, papaya, pine and fresh pepper components.

name: Idaho #7 Hop Hash
description:
Technically this is lupulin powder similar to Cryo-hops.  It is intended for use primarily in the whirlpool, hot steep or for dry hopping.

Idaho #7 has a black tea charcter and fresh herbal aroma.

A high alpha, dual purpose seedless hops with a unique hop aroma.  It can be used either for bittering or as a late hop addition to provide a flavor of citrus and passionfruit to the finished beer.

Substitutes: Chinook, Hallertauer Mittelfrueh

name: Southern Aroma 2018
description: Southern Aroma is a South African bred aroma, daylight neutral hop whose pedigree is a diploid seedling originating from Saaz and Hallertauer Mettelfreuh crossing.  The aroma profile includes floral, fields of flowers, woody/spicy, and fruity.  Total oil content is around 0.6 to 0.8 percent, alpha acids range from 3 to 6 percent, and cohumulone is very low at about 16 to 22 percent.  A hop with classic noble hop character and a fruity South African terroir backdrop.  Works well with classic European and English styles where traditional noble hops may be used, but also hop forward beers of American and Belgian origins.  Possible similar hops: Motueka.

name: Southern Aroma 2017
description: Southern Aroma is a South African bred aroma, daylight neutral hop whose pedigree is a diploid seedling originating from Saaz and Hallertauer Mettelfreuh crossing.  The aroma profile includes floral, fields of flowers, woody/spicy, and fruity.  Total oil content is around 0.6 to 0.8 percent, alpha acids range from 3 to 6 percent, and cohumulone is very low at about 16 to 22 percent.  A hop with classic noble hop character and a fruity South African terroir backdrop.  Works well with classic European and English styles where traditional noble hops may be used, but also hop forward beers of American and Belgian origins.  Possible similar hops: Motueka.

name: J17/63 (African Queen) 2016
description:
Because of the excellent alpha acids content and good yields, J17/63 gives a very high alpha acid production per hectare.

Cohumulone 26.5%, Storeability (Pellets) TBC, Isomerisation (Pellets) TBC, Total Oil ml/100g 1.3%, Humulene 21.4%, Caryophyllene 12.8%, Hum/Car Ratio 1.7, Farnesene 4.9, Myrcene 28.4%

name: Kazbek
description: From the Czech Republic, released in 2008. The classic noble spice of saaz, but with a earthy lemon peel tone.  Primarily an aroma hop for whirlpool or dry hopping.  Noble hop character but high oil content.  Similar to a very strong Saaz with notes of citrus and grapefruit.  Substitute: Saaz

name: Admiral

name: Cryo - Eukanot
description: An aromatic hop with some tropical, citrus, fruity, and herbal notes.  Lupulin powder - typically used during the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half the weight of pellet hops to mazimize aroma/flavor.  Concentrated to enhance hop oils.  Store near freezing.

name: CTZ Hop Hash
description:
Technically this is lupulin powder similar to Cryo-hops.  It is intended for use primarily in the whirlpool, hot steep or for dry hopping.

Columbus, Tomahawk and Zeus are collectively called CTZ and are similar in character and often blended.  They provide citrus aromas, black peper, licorace and curry notes.

name: Meridian
description: Grown primarily in Willamette Valley - a unique variety with crisp flavors of lemon, mixed berry and tropical fruit.  Complements many other hop flavors very well.  Some notes of nectarine, apricots, with some pine. Use in: Belgians, IPAs, Blondes.  Substitute: Citra, Glacier, Centennial

name: Multihead
description: MultiHead is a neomexicanus breed native to New Mexico and is so named because of its tendency to produce dual cones. It is a unique hop in the industry and in brewing features a heady, floral aroma and some citrus elements.

name: Cryo - Loral
description: Loral is a floral, citrus, fruity, herbal hops used for its aromatic qualities.  Versatile.  Lupulin powder - typically used during the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half the weight of pellet hops to mazimize aroma/flavor.  Concentrated to enhance hop oils. Store near freezing.

name: Loral
description: Released in 2016, Loral HBC 291 has a noble heritage and crosses old world and new world aromatics.  Pleasant aroma including floral, pepper, lemon citrus and dark fruit notes.  Suitable for many beer styles.

name: Sorachi Ace

name: Ariana
description: Developed at the hop research center in Hull, Germany.  A cross between Hurkules and a wild male.  Aromas include black currant, grapefruit, gooseberry, geranium and vanilla.

name: African Queen
description: A high alpha hop from South Africa with interesting bittering potential and fruity flavors.  Fruity aroma includes hints of blueberry, cassis, passion fruit, citrus, stone fruit, black currant, tea, lemongrass and even chili.  Can be used both for bittering and as a late addition.

name: Styrian Goldings
description:
Aroma: Mild, soft, grassy, floral aroma. Similar to Fuggles.
Substitutes: Fuggles, Williamette
